subject: p13291370
History: Fever with respiratory distress. Assess for pneumonia.
Findings: Portable AP upright view of the chest was provided. Midline sternotomy wires are again noted. There is a left chest wall pacer with lead tip in the region of the right ventricle. The heart is top normal in size. The mediastinum is slightly prominent, stable, reflecting an unfolded thoracic aorta. Aortic calcifications are present. Increased perihilar opacity is noted as well as consolidation containing an air bronchogram within the right upper lobe. Findings are concerning for pneumonia. No effusion is seen. There is no pneumothorax. The bony structures appear intact.
Impression: Perihilar and right upper lobe consolidation concerning for pneumonia.
